messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I think someone's trying to break into my home, just off of 56th Avenue.
He broke a window, and I'm home alone.
Just a window, but I don't know what he can do next. Who is he?
I don't know.
It's dangerous.
You're 14?
I think I saw.
I'm 14 and I'm all alone.
Which window did he break?
One in the back.
He already tried opening the door. That's when I heard him.
Did you see anyone?
Just a single male in a black tank top. That's all I can really give right now as a description.
And they tried to open the door in the back?
Yes.
I heard the door being pounded. I heard the knob trying to be turned.
Do you know if he's a white, black, or Latin male?
Probably, I can't see now. Maybe he went away, but probably, oh, I'm going to say white. Definitely not black, but I can't tell if he was Latino or white.
And there's not much in terms of weapons in my house, so I don't have much to defend myself.
What was he wearing?

A black tank top, and I think he had something in his hand. Whether it was a hammer or a crowbar, I couldn't tell. But I could see the glass shattering. Maybe he just did that and ran away, but I don't really know right now.
My parents are on their way home, but they're coming from Miami, so I don't know when they're going to get home.
Okay, they're coming from Miami?
Yes, my brother is moving out of college today, so...
What type of vehicle are they driving?
Considering both vehicles are gone, I would say a white Kia Sorento, a dark blue Dodge Journey, or a golden Hyundai Sonata.
Oh, definitely. He's coming in right now. You hear the glass? He's coming in.
Yes, he's coming in. I need to see him. Definitely white, black, black tank top.
Where are you at now?
I'm in the front room with my shoe horn as a weapon.
Do you hear anything?
Yes. You know the front door.
Can you go in a room and lock it?
Yes, that's something we can do right now. I am now in my bedroom.
Okay, where is your bedroom located in the house?
We have a long central hallway, and if you go down from coming in from the front door, it's the second door on the right.
Is it on the east side of the house or the west side?
I'm sorry, ma'am, I can't say that right now. I don't know.
Okay, so you don't know if it's on the east side or west side of the house?
No, I'm sorry, but it's on the opposite side of the kitchen.
Do you still hear someone?
Yes.
Ma'am, is it okay if I can...
What?
Where do you hear the person at?
In the backyard, still banging glass.
Still in the backyard?
Yeah, I don't think he's in yet. I don't hear anything now.
Okay, and your room is on the opposite side of the kitchen?
Yes.
Okay, and you can't tell if your room is towards the east side?
I'm very sorry, I haven't called them yet. I called you first.
Okay, you said your parents are on their way home?
Yes, I was thinking of putting you on speaker and sending them a quick text saying, hurry back.
So you heard them in the back, in the backyard?
Mm-hmm, in the backyard.
Okay. Can you go to the back?
No, I'm not going to scare them.
Okay, the officers are telling me now that they are in the back. They want you to go to the back.
Okay, there should be a large oak tree, or maybe two oaks.
Yes, the officer is in the back of the house.
Yellowish house?
Yes, go to the back.
Wait, wait a minute. Does the officer see the broken glass window?
Yes.
Okay, so maybe he ran away from the cops, I don't know.
So the officer wants me to go to the back?
Yes, go to the back.
Are you on a cordless phone? Can you go with the phone?
No, I'm on my cell phone.
Okay, go to the back door with your phone.
Wait, someone's in the house. I don't know if it's my family or not.
Somebody's inside the house?
Yes, I hear someone yell.
Okay, stay inside your room.
Okay.
Ma'am?
Yes?
My bedroom should be the only door closed right now.
Okay, your bedroom door should be the only door closed.
You said your bedroom is the second door from the front?
Yes, if you come in from the front door, there is a hallway.
Okay.
If you come in the front door, there's a long hallway, and it's the second door across from the kitchen.
No, you come through the front door, you take your first right, and you look left, there's a hallway.
If you walk forward from the front door, take a few steps, turn right, and go down, then turn left. There's a long hallway. My door would be the first on your right.
Okay, hold on a second.
Is there a window in your room?
Yes.
How many windows are on your side of the house in your room?
Quite a few. There's a fenced-in, greenery area where our dogs used to run around. My room is on that side.
I see someone. I don't know if it's an officer or not.
Okay, do you see them clearly?
Oh, I see an officer. I see an officer.
The officer is at your window?
He's not necessarily at my window, but he's at the front of the fenced-in area.
The officer is in front of the fence?
Yes.
Can you come out through the door by your parents' bedroom?
There's, I'm coming out right now.
Okay, you're coming out?
Yeah, there's officers inside the house. The officer has me. I'm outside.
Okay, go outside with the officer.
